acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-001: Homepage contains hero section with clear headline about ONE LINE APIs; - AC-002: API categories displayed as cards or sections (Tracking, Schedules, Booking, Routes); - AC-003: 'View Documentation' or 'Get Started' primary CTA button visible; - AC-004: Customer logos or testimonials section present
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-005: When user lands on homepage, hero section loads immediately without delay; - AC-006: Clicking 'View Documentation' CTA navigates to API Reference page; - AC-007: Clicking API category card navigates to that category's documentation section
acceptance_logic: - AC-008: Homepage is publicly accessible (no authentication required); - AC-009: Each API category card shows brief description of use cases; - AC-010: Value proposition clearly communicates benefits of using ONE LINE APIs
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-011: Hero headline and copy follow brand voice guidelines; - AC-012: Mobile viewport shows stacked layout for categories; - AC-013: Images and logos use optimized formats (WebP with fallback)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-001: Homepage loads in <2 seconds for 95% of users; - NFR-002: Lighthouse performance score ≥90; - NFR-003: Accessible (WCAG 2.1 AA compliant)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-014: API categories section shows 4 cards (Tracking, Schedules, Booking, Routes); - AC-015: Each card shows: category name, icon, 1-2 sentence description, 'Learn more' link; - AC-016: Cards arranged in grid layout (2x2 on desktop, 1 column on mobile)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-017: When user clicks category card or 'Learn more' link, navigates to API Reference for that category; - AC-018: When user hovers over card (desktop), card has subtle hover state (elevation or border)
acceptance_logic: - AC-019: Category descriptions match use cases from PRD (Tracking: track shipments, Schedules: view schedules, Booking: create bookings, Routes: find routes); - AC-020: Links navigate to correct anchor in API Reference page
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-021: Icons use consistent style (outline or solid); - AC-022: Grid adapts responsively (3 columns tablet, 1 column mobile); - AC-023: Touch targets are ≥44x44px for mobile accessibility
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-004: Category cards render immediately on homepage load

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-024: Getting Started guide is accessible from main navigation and homepage CTA; - AC-025: Guide page shows clear sections: Overview, Obtain Credentials, Authentication, First API Call, Troubleshooting; - AC-026: Each section has readable typography with code examples highlighted; - AC-027: 'Contact Support' email template link provided for credential requests
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-028: When user clicks 'Getting Started' nav link, guide page loads; - AC-029: When user clicks anchor link, page scrolls to corresponding section; - AC-030: When user clicks 'Contact Support' link, opens email with pre-filled template (To: api-support@one-line.com, Subject: API Credential Request)
acceptance_logic: - AC-031: Overview section explains available APIs and use cases; - AC-032: Obtain Credentials section provides clear instructions to contact ONE LINE support with company details; - AC-033: Authentication section explains API key usage (Authorization header format); - AC-034: First API Call section shows curl example to GET /shipments endpoint; - AC-035: Troubleshooting section lists common errors (401 Unauthorized, 403 Forbidden, 429 Rate Limit) with solutions
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-036: Code examples use syntax highlighting; - AC-037: curl examples show full request including headers; - AC-038: Email template includes placeholders for Company Name, Use Case, Contact Details; - AC-039: Guide explains no signup flow exists in MVP (credentials via support only)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-005: Guide page loads in <2 seconds; - NFR-006: Code examples are copy-able (copy button provided)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-040: Search bar visible in header or prominent location on all pages; - AC-041: Search input has placeholder text 'Search endpoints, keywords, or use cases'; - AC-042: Search results dropdown appears below search input when user types; - AC-043: Each search result shows: endpoint name, HTTP method, brief description, matching category
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-044: When user types ≥2 characters, search results appear with autocomplete suggestions (sidebar filter) or ≥3 characters (global search); - AC-045: When user clicks search result, navigates to that endpoint's documentation page; - AC-046: When user presses Enter in search input, shows full search results page; - AC-047: Search results update as user types (debounced, max 300ms delay)
acceptance_logic: - AC-048: Search indexes endpoint names, URL paths, descriptions, category names, and guide content; - AC-048a: Partial text matching (LIKE search): User input matches any substring within indexed fields - e.g. 'ship' matches 'shipment', 'shipping', '/shipments/{id}'; matching uses case-insensitive substring search (indexOf/includes); - AC-049: Search is case-insensitive and matches partial words; - AC-049a: Case-insensitive matching: Both user input and indexed content are converted to lowercase before comparison - e.g. 'TRACK' matches 'track', 'Tracking', 'tracker'; - AC-050: Results are ranked by relevance (exact match > partial match > description match); - AC-050a: Ranking algorithm for partial matches: (1) Exact match on endpoint name, (2) Prefix match - endpoint name starts with query, (3) Infix match - endpoint name contains query, (4) Match in URL path, (5) Match in description, (6) Match in category name; - AC-051: Maximum 10 results shown in autocomplete dropdown; - AC-051a: Multi-word queries: Each word is matched independently using AND logic - all words must match somewhere in the result; e.g. 'track ship' matches endpoints where both 'track' AND 'ship' appear in name/path/description/category; - AC-052: If no results found, shows 'No results found. Try different keywords' message; - AC-052a: Special character handling: Query is trimmed of leading/trailing whitespace; multiple consecutive spaces collapsed to single space; special regex characters are escaped to prevent errors
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-053: Search bar is accessible (ARIA labels, keyboard navigable); - AC-054: Escape key closes search dropdown; - AC-055: Arrow keys navigate search results, Enter selects highlighted result; - AC-056: Mobile viewport shows expandable search icon (magnifying glass) that opens full-width search bar
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-007: Search results return in <500ms for 95% of queries; - NFR-008: Search index updates automatically when documentation changes

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-057: API Reference page shows sidebar navigation with categories (Tracking, Schedules, Booking, Routes); - AC-058: Each category is expandable/collapsible and shows list of endpoints beneath; - AC-059: Main content area shows endpoint documentation; - AC-060: Sidebar highlights currently viewed section
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-061: When user clicks category in sidebar, category expands showing child endpoints; - AC-062: When user clicks endpoint in sidebar, main content scrolls to that endpoint's documentation; - AC-063: Sidebar remains fixed on scroll (sticky positioning) on desktop; - AC-064: Active endpoint is highlighted in sidebar as user scrolls through documentation
acceptance_logic: - AC-065: Categories and endpoints match USL structure (all 17 stories mapped to endpoints); - AC-066: Sidebar shows endpoint count per category; - AC-067: Endpoints are listed alphabetically within each category
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-068: Mobile viewport: sidebar toggles via hamburger menu icon; - AC-069: Sidebar uses smooth scroll when navigating to endpoints; - AC-070: Closed categories show collapsed arrow icon, open categories show expanded arrow icon
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-009: Sidebar navigation is accessible (keyboard navigable, screen reader friendly); - NFR-010: Sidebar loads in <1 second

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-071: Each endpoint documentation shows: Endpoint URL, HTTP method badge (GET/POST/etc), Description, Authentication requirements, Request parameters table (Name, Type, Required, Description), Response schema with example JSON, Error codes table (Code, Description, Solution); - AC-072: Parameters table distinguishes path, query, and body parameters; - AC-073: Response schema shows nested objects with proper indentation; - AC-074: Example JSON is syntax highlighted and formatted
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-075: When user views endpoint documentation, all sections are expanded by default; - AC-076: Code blocks (request/response examples) have 'Copy' button that copies text to clipboard; - AC-077: When user clicks parameter type (e.g. 'string'), shows tooltip with format details if applicable; - AC-078: Response example can toggle between success response and error response samples
acceptance_logic: - AC-079: Authentication section specifies API key in Authorization header format (e.g. 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY'); - AC-080: Request parameters indicate if required or optional; - AC-081: Response schema includes field types (string, number, object, array) and descriptions; - AC-082: Error codes table includes HTTP status codes (400, 401, 403, 404, 429, 500) with ONE LINE-specific error messages
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-083: Long endpoint URLs wrap or scroll horizontally without breaking layout; - AC-084: Example JSON uses realistic sample data (not 'Lorem ipsum'); - AC-085: Rate limit information is documented for each endpoint or in general section
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-011: Endpoint documentation page loads in <2 seconds; - NFR-012: Code copy operation completes instantly (<100ms); - NFR-013: Documentation is SEO-optimized (proper meta tags, headings)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-086: Each endpoint documentation shows code example tabs for 4+ languages (curl, JavaScript, Python, Java); - AC-087: Code example shows complete working example including authentication header, request, and expected response; - AC-088: Each code tab has 'Copy' button; - AC-089: Syntax highlighting applied to all code examples
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-090: When user clicks language tab (e.g. 'JavaScript'), code example switches to that language; - AC-091: When user clicks 'Copy' button, code is copied to clipboard and button shows 'Copied!' feedback for 2 seconds; - AC-092: Selected language tab persists across page navigations (stored in localStorage)
acceptance_logic: - AC-093: Code examples use proper SDK or library for each language (e.g. fetch API for JavaScript, requests library for Python); - AC-094: All code examples include placeholder for API key (e.g. 'YOUR_API_KEY'); - AC-095: Code examples show how to handle response and errors
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-096: Code examples follow language-specific best practices and conventions; - AC-097: Java examples use modern Java syntax (Java 11+); - AC-098: JavaScript examples use ES6+ syntax (async/await)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-014: Language tab switching is instant (<50ms); - NFR-015: Code copy operation works across all major browsers; - NFR-016: Code examples are tested to ensure they work as shown

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-099: Sidebar navigation shows expandable categories (Tracking, Schedules, Booking, Routes) with endpoint list; - AC-100: Sidebar is fixed/sticky on scroll for desktop viewports; - AC-101: Currently active section is highlighted in sidebar; - AC-102: Sidebar shows expand/collapse icons for categories
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-103: When user scrolls page, sidebar highlights currently visible endpoint; - AC-104: When user clicks category, expands/collapses endpoint list with smooth animation; - AC-105: When user clicks endpoint link, page scrolls smoothly to that endpoint's documentation; - AC-106: Sidebar remains accessible during scroll (no flickering or layout shift)
acceptance_logic: - AC-107: Sidebar highlight logic detects which endpoint documentation is currently in viewport (uses intersection observer); - AC-108: Clicking collapsed category expands it and scrolls to first endpoint; - AC-109: Only one category can be expanded at a time (accordion behavior) OR all categories can be expanded (decide based on UX)
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-110: Mobile viewport (<768px): sidebar hidden by default, accessible via hamburger menu icon in header; - AC-111: Tablet viewport (768-1024px): sidebar width reduced or toggleable; - AC-112: Smooth scroll uses CSS scroll-behavior or JavaScript smooth scroll polyfill
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-017: Sidebar navigation is keyboard accessible (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys); - NFR-018: Sidebar scroll position persists on page reload (localStorage); - NFR-019: Sidebar performance: highlighting updates in <100ms

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-113: Breadcrumbs navigation appears at top of content area showing: Home > API Reference > [Category] > [Endpoint]; - AC-114: Each breadcrumb level is clickable link; - AC-115: Current page (endpoint) is not linked in breadcrumbs; - AC-116: Endpoint documentation has table of contents with anchor links to sections (Description, Authentication, Parameters, Response, Errors, Examples)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-117: When user clicks breadcrumb link, navigates to that page; - AC-118: When user clicks table of contents anchor link, page scrolls smoothly to that section; - AC-119: URL updates with hash fragment when user clicks anchor or scrolls to section (e.g. #authentication)
acceptance_logic: - AC-120: Breadcrumbs are generated dynamically based on current page location; - AC-121: Anchor links use URL hash fragments for deep linking (sharable URLs); - AC-122: Page scroll position accounts for fixed header offset
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-123: Breadcrumbs use semantic HTML (<nav>, <ol>); - AC-124: Mobile viewport: breadcrumbs may wrap or truncate with ellipsis; - AC-125: Breadcrumb separator uses '>' or '/' character
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-020: Breadcrumbs are accessible (ARIA breadcrumb navigation, screen reader friendly); - NFR-021: Anchor link scroll is smooth and completes in <500ms

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-126: Error documentation page or section accessible from navigation or search; - AC-127: Errors organized by HTTP status code (400, 401, 403, 404, 429, 500) with ONE LINE-specific error messages; - AC-128: Each error entry shows: HTTP status code, Error name, Description, Common causes, Solution/How to fix; - AC-129: Search functionality works on error documentation page
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-130: When user searches for error code (e.g. '401'), search returns matching error documentation; - AC-131: When user browses error documentation, can expand/collapse error details; - AC-132: Clicking error code in endpoint documentation links to full error explanation
acceptance_logic: - AC-133: Error codes table includes: 400 (Bad Request - Invalid parameters), 401 (Unauthorized - Missing or invalid API key), 403 (Forbidden - Insufficient permissions), 404 (Not Found - Resource not found), 429 (Rate Limit Exceeded - Too many requests), 500 (Internal Server Error - Server issue); - AC-134: Each error shows example request that would trigger the error and correct request example
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-135: Error documentation includes troubleshooting tips (e.g. 'Check API key is in Authorization header'); - AC-136: Links to Getting Started guide for authentication errors; - AC-137: Error messages use developer-friendly language (not just HTTP status text)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-022: Error documentation search returns results in <500ms; - NFR-023: Error page loads in <2 seconds

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-138: Each error code entry shows detailed explanation section with: Common causes list (2-3 bullet points), Example incorrect request (code block), Example correct request (code block), Link to related documentation; - AC-139: Code examples use syntax highlighting
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-140: When user views error explanation, all sections (causes, examples, related docs) are visible without requiring expansion; - AC-141: When user clicks 'related documentation' link, navigates to relevant endpoint or guide; - AC-142: Error examples show realistic scenarios (not generic placeholders)
acceptance_logic: - AC-143: Common causes for 401 Unauthorized: Missing Authorization header, Invalid API key, Expired API key (if applicable); - AC-144: Common causes for 400 Bad Request: Invalid parameter format, Missing required parameter, Out-of-range value; - AC-145: Common causes for 429 Rate Limit: Exceeded requests per minute/hour limit; - AC-146: Correct request examples show proper parameter formatting and authentication
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-147: Error explanations are written in plain language accessible to junior developers; - AC-148: Examples use curl for simplicity (with note that same principles apply to other languages); - AC-149: Related documentation links point to Getting Started, Authentication section, or specific endpoint docs
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-024: Error explanation page is indexable by search engines for SEO

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-150: Authentication documentation section shows: API key format, How to include API key in request (Authorization header), Example authenticated request (curl and code); - AC-151: Rate limits documentation shows: Requests per minute/hour limit, How to check rate limit status (response headers), What happens when limit exceeded (429 error)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-152: When user reads authentication docs, sees clear example of Authorization header format (e.g. 'Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY'); - AC-153: Rate limits section explains how to find remaining quota in API response headers (e.g. X-RateLimit-Remaining)
acceptance_logic: - AC-154: Authentication method is API key in Authorization header (Bearer token format); - AC-155: Rate limits are defined per API key (e.g. 100 requests per minute, 1000 per hour); - AC-156: Rate limit exceeded response includes Retry-After header indicating when to retry; - AC-157: Sandbox environment (if exists) may have different rate limits than production
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-158: Authentication docs clarify that API keys are obtained via ONE LINE support (no self-service signup in MVP); - AC-159: Rate limits section notes that limits may vary by customer tier (future Phase 2); - AC-160: Security best practices: Don't commit API keys to version control, Rotate keys periodically, Use environment variables
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-025: Authentication and rate limit documentation is highly visible (linked from Getting Started and every endpoint); - NFR-026: Code examples demonstrate proper secret management (env vars, not hardcoded)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-161: Changelog page accessible from main navigation (top nav or footer); - AC-162: Changelog shows list of updates sorted by date (newest first); - AC-163: Each changelog entry shows: Date (YYYY-MM-DD), Update type tag (Added, Changed, Fixed, Deprecated, Removed), Short summary; - AC-164: Entries grouped by month or version (if versioned)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-165: When user visits Changelog page, entries load immediately; - AC-166: When user clicks changelog entry, expands to show detailed description; - AC-167: Changelog updates are sorted chronologically (newest at top)
acceptance_logic: - AC-168: Changelog includes all API changes: New endpoints, New fields in responses, Deprecated fields or endpoints, Breaking changes, Bug fixes; - AC-169: Update type tags use semantic labels (Added: new feature, Changed: modification, Deprecated: will be removed, Removed: deleted)
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-170: Changelog uses clear semantic versioning if APIs are versioned; - AC-171: Breaking changes are prominently marked (e.g. with 'Breaking Change' badge); - AC-172: Changelog is available as RSS feed for subscriptions (optional)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-027: Changelog page loads in <2 seconds; - NFR-028: Changelog is SEO-optimized (helps developers discover updates); - NFR-029: Changelog content stored in markdown or database for easy updates

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-173: Each changelog entry has expandable detailed description section showing: Affected endpoints list, Migration guide or code examples, Link to updated documentation; - AC-174: Migration guide shows before/after code examples if applicable
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-175: When user clicks collapsed changelog entry, expands to show full details with smooth animation; - AC-176: When user clicks 'View updated docs' link, navigates to affected endpoint documentation; - AC-177: Expanded changelog entry shows all details inline (no modal or separate page)
acceptance_logic: - AC-178: Affected endpoints list shows endpoint URLs and HTTP methods; - AC-179: Migration guide explains what changed and how to update existing integrations; - AC-180: For breaking changes, migration guide is mandatory; - AC-181: For new fields, example response shows new field with description
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-182: Migration guide uses clear language (e.g. 'Before: field was string, Now: field is object'); - AC-183: Code examples show both old and new request/response format; - AC-184: Links to updated docs use anchor links to jump to changed section (e.g. #response-schema)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-030: Changelog entry expansion is instant (<100ms); - NFR-031: Migration guides are tested to ensure accuracy

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-185: Changelog entry detail section includes links to affected endpoint documentation; - AC-186: Links are clearly labeled (e.g. 'View GET /shipments/{id} docs' not just 'View docs')
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-187: When user clicks 'View [endpoint] docs' link from changelog, navigates to that endpoint's documentation page; - AC-188: Endpoint documentation page highlights or indicates recently changed sections (e.g. 'Updated 2025-12-01' badge on changed field); - AC-189: User can navigate back to changelog from endpoint page (breadcrumbs or back button)
acceptance_logic: - AC-190: Links navigate to specific endpoint with anchor to changed section (e.g. /api-reference/tracking#get-shipments-response); - AC-191: If multiple endpoints affected, all are linked in changelog entry
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-192: Endpoint documentation shows 'Recently updated' badge or indicator for fields changed in last 30 days; - AC-193: Navigation maintains context (e.g. back button or breadcrumb shows 'Changelog' as previous page)
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-032: Navigation from changelog to docs is instant (client-side routing if SPA); - NFR-033: Updated field indicators are subtle but noticeable (avoid overwhelming UX)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-194: Each documentation page (endpoint, guide, changelog) has feedback widget at bottom; - AC-195: Feedback widget shows: 'Was this page helpful?' heading, Star rating (1-5 stars), Optional text input for comments, Submit button; - AC-196: Widget is minimally intrusive (small, bottom of page or side panel)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-197: When user clicks star rating, stars highlight up to selected rating; - AC-198: When user clicks Submit, feedback is recorded and widget shows 'Thank you for your feedback!' confirmation; - AC-199: After submitting, widget collapses or shows only confirmation message; - AC-200: Widget does not require authentication (anonymous feedback allowed)
acceptance_logic: - AC-201: Star rating is required to submit; text comment is optional; - AC-202: Feedback data includes: Page URL, Rating (1-5), Optional comment, Timestamp, User agent (for device context); - AC-203: Feedback is stored in database or analytics platform for review
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-204: Feedback widget uses accessible ARIA labels and keyboard navigation; - AC-205: Mobile viewport: widget is responsive and doesn't block content; - AC-206: Feedback widget appears on all documentation pages but not on homepage
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-034: Feedback submission completes in <1 second; - NFR-035: Feedback widget does not impact page load performance (<50ms delay); - NFR-036: Feedback data is stored securely and anonymously (no PII collected)

acceptance_ui_elements: - AC-207: Feedback widget includes expandable text input field for written comments; - AC-208: Text input has placeholder 'Tell us more (optional)' and character limit (500 characters); - AC-209: Character count shown below text input (e.g. '250/500'); - AC-210: Submit button is enabled even if comment is empty (rating alone is sufficient)
acceptance_ui_behavior: - AC-211: When user clicks in text input, field expands to multi-line textarea (3-5 rows); - AC-212: When user types, character count updates in real-time; - AC-213: When user reaches character limit, input stops accepting characters and shows warning ('Limit reached'); - AC-214: When user submits with comment, both rating and comment are saved
acceptance_logic: - AC-215: Text input accepts alphanumeric characters, punctuation, and line breaks; - AC-216: Submitted comments are stored with associated rating and page URL; - AC-217: Empty comments (whitespace only) are treated as no comment; - AC-218: Feedback data is available for product team review via admin dashboard (future)
acceptance_special_notes: - AC-219: Text input is accessible (ARIA labels, keyboard navigable); - AC-220: Long comments wrap properly within textarea; - AC-221: Mobile viewport: textarea is touch-friendly and doesn't trigger zoom
non_functional_requirements: - NFR-037: Character count updates instantly (<50ms); - NFR-038: Feedback submission with comment completes in <1.5 seconds; - NFR-039: User comments are stored securely and reviewed for abuse/spam
